title: How to Clean a Nugget Couch: Machine Washing & Spot Cleaning

steps.title: Remove the covers from the foam inserts.
steps.content: Remove the covers from the foam inserts. Do not wash the covers with the foam still inserted. Unzip the fabric covers from the pillows, cushion, and base and take out each foam piece. Place the foam in an area away from children and pets to prevent any damage. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Wash the covers on your washing machine’s coldest setting.
steps.content: Wash the covers on your washing machine’s coldest setting. Zip the covers up and place them in the washing machine. Use the coldest setting to help preserve the covers' color. Only wash Nugget covers together if they are the same color to prevent color bleeding. [2] X Research source Do not wash the Outdoor Nugget covers or the embroidered pillow covers. These are spot clean only. [3] X Research source Nugget recommends using a clear detergent , such as All’s Free Clear .

steps.title: Set the covers out to dry.
steps.content: Set the covers out to dry. Remove the covers from the washing machine and put them on a clothing line or rack to dry overnight. Do not place the covers in a dryer, as it can cause shrinking. Use a fan to speed up drying. [4] X Research source You can dry the covers outside, but do not leave them out for long. Direct sunlight will cause the fabric to fade. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Put the couch back together once the covers are dry.
steps.content: Put the couch back together once the covers are dry. Unzip the dried pillow covers, cushion, and base and insert the corresponding foam pieces. Zip the covers back up to start creating fun, new configurations! [6] X Research source

steps.title: Use a vacuum cleaner to remove any loose dirt.
steps.content: Use a vacuum cleaner to remove any loose dirt. Clean up crumbs and pet hair on your Nugget beforehand so that debris isn't embedded into the pillows or cushions. Vacuum with a brush attachment or use a lint roller. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Unzip the covers and take out the foam.
steps.content: Unzip the covers and take out the foam. Spot cleaning the covers while the foam is inside can transfer the stain to the foam. Remove the fabric covers from the pillows, cushion, and base. Set aside the foam in a safe place while you clean. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Spray set-in stains with an upholstery cleaner.
steps.content: Spray set-in stains with an upholstery cleaner. Find stains on your pillows, cushion, and base and spray them directly with an upholstery cleaner. Spray enough cleaner to dampen each spot and loosen the stain, but not so much that the area is soaked. [9] X Research source Nugget recommends using cleaners such as Folex , Oxiclean , Woolite , and Dawn dish soap for stains like chocolate, condiments, fruit, and grease. Use rubbing alcohol for crayons, markers, and glue and acetone for nail polish. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Rub the cleaner into the stains with a moist towel.
steps.content: Rub the cleaner into the stains with a moist towel. Use a soft, white towel or washcloth to prevent color from transferring to the covers. Dampen your towel. In circular motions, gently rub and dab your towel into the areas where you sprayed the cleaner. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Machine wash the covers on the coldest setting.
steps.content: Machine wash the covers on the coldest setting. Zip up each cover and put them in the washing machine. Keep your covers bright by using your machine’s coldest setting. Prevent any color bleeding by only washing Nugget covers of the same color. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Let the covers dry before assembling your Nugget.
steps.content: Let the covers dry before assembling your Nugget. Place the covers on a clothing rack to air dry overnight. Once the covers are dry, unzip them and add back in the foam. Assemble the couch into your favorite creation and enjoy!

steps.title: Remove the foam from the fabric covers.
steps.content: Remove the foam from the fabric covers. To clean up any spills that have leaked into the fabric and set into the foam, you need to clean the foam directly. Unzip the pillow, cushion, and base covers and take out each foam piece. Place the covers in a safe place where they won’t get dirty. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Spray any stains on the foam with an upholstery cleaner.
steps.content: Spray any stains on the foam with an upholstery cleaner. Dispense the cleaner directly onto any stains you find on the foam pillows, cushion, and base. Help the spots dry faster by only dampening the stains with cleaner. [14] X Research source The Nugget couch isn’t waterproof, so be careful with the amount of cleaner you use. Nugget recommends using Folex on the foam for the best clean.

steps.title: Wipe the cleaner into the stains using a damp towel.
steps.content: Wipe the cleaner into the stains using a damp towel. Dab a dampened towel or washcloth into the spots where you sprayed the cleaner. Let the spots sit for 30 minutes, then wipe them again with a moist towel. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Dry the foam out before putting the Nugget together.
steps.content: Dry the foam out before putting the Nugget together. Completely air dry the foam to prevent any mildew from forming. Add the foam back into the covers once the foam is fully dry. [16] X Research source Place the foam pieces by an open window or in front of a fan to help them dry faster. [17] X Research source
